  • Method Details

    • isValidIPAddress

      public static boolean isValidIPAddress(String ip)
      Validates an IPv4 address. This method checks if the provided string is a valid IPv4 address. A valid IPv4 address consists of four octets, each ranging from 0 to 255, separated by periods (".").
      Parameters:
      ip - the string representation of the IPv4 address to validate
      Returns:
      true if the string is a valid IPv4 address, false otherwise

    • isNameValid

      public static boolean isNameValid(String name)
      Checks if the provided name is valid based on the following criteria:
      • The name is not null.
      • The name does not contain any spaces.
      • The name only contains alphanumeric characters and underscores.
      • The name has a length between 4 and 14 characters, inclusive.
      Parameters:
      name - the name to be validated
      Returns:
      true if the name is valid, false otherwise

    • isPasswordValid

      public static boolean isPasswordValid(String password)
      Checks if the provided password is valid based on the following criteria:
      • The password is not null.
      • The password does not contain any spaces.
      • The password has a length between 5 and 20 characters, inclusive.
      Parameters:
      password - the password to be validated
      Returns:
      true if the password is valid, false otherwise

    • isParsableAsInt

      public static boolean isParsableAsInt(String input)
      Checks if a given string can be parsed as an integer.
      Parameters:
      input - the string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string can be parsed as an integer, false otherwise

    • checkInputBound

      public static boolean checkInputBound(String input, int lowerBound, int upperBound)
      Checks user input against specified bounds.

      This method reads an integer input from the user and checks if it falls within the specified lower and upper bounds (inclusive). If the input is not within the bounds, it prompts the user to enter a valid number within the specified range and continues to do so until a valid input is provided.

      Parameters:
      lowerBound - The lower bound of the acceptable range.
      upperBound - The upper bound of the acceptable range.
      Returns:
      The integer input entered by the user within the specified bounds.

    • isCharWithinBounds

      public static boolean isCharWithinBounds(char ch, int lowerBound, int upperBound)
      Checks if a given character is within the specified bounds.
      Parameters:
      ch - the character to check
      lowerBound - the lower bound (inclusive)
      upperBound - the upper bound (inclusive)
      Returns:
      true if the character is within the bounds; false otherwise

    • validBinaryChoice

      public static boolean validBinaryChoice(String input)
      Reads a binary choice (1 or 2) from the user input.

      This method prompts the user to enter a binary choice, either 1 or 2, and reads the input from the console. It continues to prompt the user until a valid input is provided.

      Returns:
      The binary choice entered by the user (1 or 2).
